name: Captain's House Inn

reviews.title: Comfortable & convenient
reviews.text: We stayed in the Lydia Harding Suite for four nights. It was extremely comfortable & very quiet except for the last evening when one of the guest below decided to use the whirlpool bath for half an hour & then have a battle with the other guest below as to who could have the television the loudest. I never understand why these places fit whirlpool baths they are just noisy & intrusive to other guests & we never use them for that reason. Maybe they are a novelty to some people. There is a large hotel in Kennebunkport that has no TVs in the rooms - that must be absolute heaven. I have to agree with a previous reviewer about the owners. They never introduced themselves to us and for some time we just thought that they were staff. However, all the staff - that includes the cleaners & groundsmen were all very efficient & friendly & my waistline is still feeling the effects of the breakfasts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all excellent service & comfort that in some respects would shame some so called luxury hotels.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Captain's House Inn (10/19 - 10/21). We absolutely loved everything about our stay. We stayed in the Lydia Harding Suite. What a huge, wonderful room. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Breakfast every morning was simply out of this world. Each morning we were more than happy with our choices and selections. The staff were all very pleasant. They knew who we were without evening having to tell them. We saw and spoke with Jill each morning during breakfast. She was incredibly pleasant and helpful in planning out activities.
reviews.title: Customer service - lacking by the Inn-keepers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I were to be extremely picky, the only thing that wasn't superb was the smell of our room. It smelt a little musty and closed up. However, this is to be expected with a property this old.
reviews.title: Luxury Inn with ambition

likes.liked: — Quality of food, furnishing and staff

reviews.title: A very enjoyable vacation
reviews.text: All in all, we would definitely do it again. And, we have already recommended it to our friends!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually got engaged in James and Jill's previous B&B in Chatham in Nov. 2004 and were so excited to get the chance to stay with them again at their new B&B the Captain's House. We were not disappointed with our recent stay, our hosts were there to offer friendly advice on where to go for lunch/dinner and places to go while we were staying in Chatham/the cape. We even revisited some of the places that James and Jill recommend on our first trip.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Relaxing and Historic B&B - A Must in Chatham!!!

likes.liked: — The hosts, location and the food

reviews.text: Our room was the Wild Hunter and we were so excited to see that it had a huge bathroom with walk-in shower and jacuzzi and a fireplace, very romantic. The room was quiet, although we had people directly over us we didn't hear a peep. In the moring, we arrived late the night before, we noticed that we had a great outdoor sitting area on the back of our room, great for relaxing/reading a book in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Great Place
Charming
reviews.text: My husband and I loved it here. Everything is exactly as it appears on the inn's website: The room was very big (we stayed in Whirlwind), the property is beautiful, and the breakfast and tea were amazing. We would stay again in a second.

Just returned from 4 days at this Inn where we met up with our two young adult daughters. We absolutely loved the Inn and will certainly return if we are back in Chatham. Charming and clean with friendly, helpful service and attractive grounds. The breakfasts were great, the only problem being that we ate too much! Both of our rooms had more than enough space and were nicely decorated. The location is very convenient and the staff was most helpful with recommendations for dining and other activities. Reviewers who fault the Inn for falling short of a 5 star hotel shouldn't be staying in a B&B. This is not a Ritz Carlton and should not be compared to one. It is a warm, comfortable, inviting and attracitve place to return to after a day's activities. Probably the nicest B&B we have stayed in, but not inexpensive. There are some minor details that need some attention, and I have no doubt they will be taken care of, but nothing that detracts from the overall very positive experience.
reviews.title: A Great B&B

likes.liked: — Everything I want in a B&B, and more
likes.disliked: — A bit pricey for a B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I explain why I gave a four star rating instead of a five, I want to make clear that I would not hesitate to return to this wonderful inn. The service could not have been better. The staff is primarily composed of young women hospitality interns from Great Britain and they couldn't have been nicer. The property is beautifully maintained and the interior design brings to mind Laura Ashley and Martha Stewart. The owners are visible and involved in daily operations and they run a tight ship. They gave me a few excellent recommendations for dinner and they provided convenient printouts containing driving directions to just about any nearby destination worth going to. They are also very nice people and they made us feel at home.
reviews.title: Wonderful, with one caveat

likes.disliked: — The room was too small. The small size should be mentioned on the website.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here is my one probem. The room I booked was too small (narrow with low ceiling). Fortunately I am under 6 feet tall, otherwise there is no way I could have stayed here for three days. It was quite cramped with little space to walk around and no room to stretch your legs comfortably. I re-checked the website when I got home and there is no indication as to the room's small size (it's the Garden Room). The room photo on the website disguises the fact by having a closeup of the bed. I checked the photos of the other rooms (which were slightly more expensive) and I noticed that the photos showed the rooms in their entirety. If you make a reservation here (which I encourage you to do) I suggest you reserve one of these larger rooms unless you're one of those people for whom size doesn't matter.

description: A most distinctive Cape Cod bed and breakfast, the Captain's House Inn is regarded by many respected lodging reviewers as perhaps "The Cape's" finest small inn. This four-diamond sea captain's estate on two acres in Chatham, Massachusetts is the perfect choice for a romantic getaway or a peaceful retreat from the workaday world.
